title: Romantic and Raw, Altuzarra's F/W 25 Show Was a Study in Contrasts
Kendrick Lamar’s bootcut jeans steal Super Bowl half-time show
description: Rapper’s blue-washed pair by Celine were object of derision and lust in momentous performanceThe game on the pitch at Super Bowl on Sunday night was only half the story. As the Philadelphia Eagles led 24-0 over the Kansas City Chiefs, a pair of jeans worn by the American rapper and Pulitzer prize winner Kendrick Lamar for his half-time performance commanded their own crowd online.Variously identified as bootcut, flared and bell-bottomed, the pair of blue-wash jeans were the object of derision and lust. “Kendrick wearing bootcut jeans was so special,” said the writer and comedian Sophia Benoit on social media. “I could not take my eyes off his hems,” said another user. Continue reading...
author: Ellie Violet Bramley

title: The sneakerina: must-have item or step too far for hybrid fashion?
description: Hot on the heals of the ‘snoafer’, the ballerina flat/sneaker mashup is emerging as a key footwear trend for springFirst came jeggings. Then skousers. Now there is a new hybrid entry being added to the fashion lexicon. The sneakerina. Yes, shoes that are an amalgamation of a ballerina flat and a sneaker are quickly emerging as a key footwear trend for spring.The top of this new cross-breed typically features all the delicate design features of a traditional ballet flat such as bow detailing and an almond-shaped silhouette, but the classic flat sole has been replaced with a chunkier heavy-duty version usually found on a sneaker. Continue reading...
author: Chloe Mac Donnell

title: Wes Gordon Designed With the Perspective of a Cinematic Gardener for Carolina Herrera Fall 2025
description: For his Fall 2025 collection for Carolina Herrera, creative director Wes Gordon brought the garden from one of his favorite films, "Being There" (1979) to life. title: The 44 Best Presidents’ Day Sales To Shop Now
description: .disclaimer{width:90%;margin-bottom:1rem}.disclaimer__lines{width:100%;margin:0 auto;border-bottom:1px solid #999;padding:0;max-width:150px}.disclaimer__copy{width:100%;max-width:355px;font-family:Brown Regular,sans-serif;font-size:.9rem;font-weight:300;line-height:1.3em;color:#333;padding:0 0 .4rem;margin:1rem auto;text-align:center} All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission. 2025 has been…rough so far, to say the least. So with the first holiday weekend of the year nigh, we’re ready for a break — and some well-earned retail therapy. And while Presidents’ Day is a major sale occasion in and of itself, it might as well be called Mattress Day, since discounts on all things sleep-related are plentiful this time of year. But bedding and mattresses aren’t the only deals you’ll find this upcoming Presidents’ Day: Whether you’re in the market for some marked-down beauty, fashion editor-approved clothing and accessories, or home décor, we have you covered with the best Presidents’ Day sales taking place this weekend. From major discounts on cozy loungewear to new sale finds at R29-reader-favorite retailers like Nordstrom, Free People, among others, this is your one-and-only place to get all the must-shop sales. (Pro tip: Presidents’ Day deals are already here ahead of the long weekend, so feel free to get a head start on your shopping before the good stuff sells out.) author: Mercedes Viera

title: New York Fashion Week Street Style Will Inspire Your Next Outfit
description: It’s early February, which means our bodies (and minds) are officially over the winter chill and dreary skies. But, thankfully, New York Fashion Week — and its flurry of eye-catching street style looks — is here to lift our moods. From February 6 to 11, the most fashion-forward creators, celebrities, designers, editors, and industry insiders are taking to the NYC streets. And by the looks coming out of the New York Fashion Week fall/winter 2025 shows, they are dressing to impress — or at least leave a mark on our IG feeds. The wide array of street style outfits offer a fresh, inviting perspective on how we’ll be able to wear the year’s budding trends moving into spring. Wondering how to experiment with suiting, all-monochrome looks, and infuse color into your wardrobe? There’s a NYFW street style look ready to give you some inspo. So, keep scrolling to discover some of our favorites.  Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Like what you see? author: Patricia Karounos

title: An Ode to Kendrick Lamar's Bell Bottoms - and Where to Shop Similar Styles
description: In all the hype leading up to the 2025 Super Bowl, who could have predicted that the biggest winner of last night's game would be... Kendrick Lamar's jeans? That's right: fresh off the heels of his five Grammy wins at the 67th Grammy Awards, Lamar took the stage for Apple's Super Bowl Halftime Show on Sunday, Feb. 9, with a headlining performance that included hit songs from the rapper's expansive catalog - including everything from "Humble" to "All the Stars" featuring SZA and yes, even his infamous Drake diss track, "Not Like Us" (currently on repeat today). While the musician's Halftime performance was legendary in its own right (we're still not over that Serena Williams cameo!), Lamar's outfit choice for the spectacle proved to inspire just as much discourse online - specifically his oversize flare jeans. The washed denim pants - which I was able to identify as a now sold-out $1,300 Celine style - weren't quite as flamboyant as a '70s-esque bell bottom, nor were they as tame as a classic bootcut style; but the throwback jeans still felt quintessentially Y2K, with a light wash coloring and exaggerated silhouette that flared at the knees. As a self-proclaimed jean girlie, I love how Lamar's Super Bowl outfit felt like a casual departure from the glitzy performance looks of year's past, and one that signaled the return of retro denim - because of course Kendrick Lamar would be the one to make bell bottoms cool again. Whether you're looking to replicate Lamar's Super Bowl ensemble or simply want a way to tap into the quiet-luxury trend, I scoured the internet and rounded up a few of the best flare jeans for women - with styles inspired by the star's viral denim.
author: Kyley Warren

title: Taylor Swift Rewears "T" Chain to Support Travis Kelce at the Super Bowl - Shop Here
description: Taylor Swift is no stranger to initial jewelry, but the pop star's latest take on the trend is helping to usher in a new era for the accessory. Swift attended the 2025 Super Bowl on Sunday, Feb. 9, wearing a "T" thigh chain as a necklace. She paired the jewelry with a white blazer and tank top, matching knee-high boots, and her signature red lip. The necklace features ruby heart stones and a glittery "T" initial that could stand for Taylor or her boyfriend Travis Kelce. According to People, the accessory was custom-designed by Swift in collaboration with the star's stylist Joseph Cassell and famed jeweler Lorraine Schwartz. Image Source: Getty Images / Jamie Squire Earlier, at the 2025 Grammys on Sunday, Feb. 2, the musician donned the same initial necklace hanging on her thigh. The beaded chain was situated on Swift's upper left leg, peeking out ever-so-slightly beneath her Vivienne Westwood dress's sky-high slit. Swift's micro frock was adorned with sequin embellishments and featured a statement "Chiefs red" color that fans speculated was also a nod to Kelce's team. During the Grammys, Swifties - ever the internet sleuths - immediately drew comparisons between the thigh necklace and lyrics from Swift's Grammy-nominated album, "The Tortured Poets Department." In the song "Guilty As Sin?" she sings, "What if he's written 'mine' on my upper thigh, only in my mind?" Admittedly, the whole thing felt very Troy-Gabriella-coded from "High School Musical 2" - which the internet reliably depicted in memes. But for fashion girlies (like myself), Swift's thigh chain inspired a different kind of speculation beyond just her boyfriend - including whether or not the star might've just soft-launched a new category of personalized jewelry, and by extension, spring's biggest fashion trend? Image Source: Getty Images / Jamie Squire Body chains and initial jewelry certainly aren't new, but when reimagined together, they offer a whole new approach: you can don the initials of your own name or pay homage to your partner, all while concealing the jewelry beneath your everyday clothes, choosing to playfully tease the accessory like Swift did at the Grammys, or reworking it later as a necklace like she did at the Super Bowl. While the pop star's necklace is custom-made, there are ways to recreate her look before the thigh-chain trend takes off on TikTok. Ahead, I rounded up similar variations of Swift's body chain, with everything from chain belts to lengthy belly chains, initial hand chains, and more. Keep reading to shop the pop-star-approved jewelry trend.
author: Kyley Warren
